reviews.title: perfect

reviews.text: everything works to perfection. Free car to take you anywhere and back.
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Room was ready early and we were allowed a 2pm late check out without any problems.
reviews.title: Fantastic place to stay in downtown Seattle

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Could not ask for anything better.
reviews.title: Outstanding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: extremely trendy, price sensitive, great location, very clean and knowledgeable staff. great bar and food. very unexpected but a must for biz or vacation travel.
reviews.title: Great for romance!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at Hotel 1000 for our 3 year anniversary and we were both blown away by the exceptional service and beautiful decor. Upon checking in, Katie from the front desk was kind enough to accompany us up to the room and explain the room's amenities (including the awesome tub that fills from the ceiling!) We received a lovely surprise of sparkling wine and strawberries in our corner room, and had a relaxing, quiet stay, even though the hotel is situated on a busy street. We stayed on the 8th floor and did not hear any street noise at all.
reviews.title: Exceptional!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: The room service menu is wonderful, as well as the late night happy hour menu (10PM-midnight) at BOKA, the hotel's restaurant. During happy hour, all small plates are half price, giving us a chance to try a little of everything.
reviews.title: The best hotel in Seattle

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The fitness center is more well equipped than most boutique hotels, and features 2 elliptical trainers and 2 treadmills (all with built in TVs), as well as a few weight machines and free weights.
reviews.title: A great night's sleep!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What really sets the Hotel 1000 apart from other high-end boutique hotels is the service. Not only are the employees attentive, but rather than being cold and arrogant, everyone there is incredibly friendly and accomodating.
reviews.title: Noisy, Noisy, Noisy!

likes.liked: — I was too tired to notice.
likes.disliked: — The noise of car stereos and loud bass.

reviews.title: Funky downtown Seattle Boutique Hotel
reviews.text: My husband and I started our PNW vacation at this gorgeous hotel on June 22 and stayed for 4 nights. My review is a balanced review that will hopefully paint a very fair picture of our stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Positives:
reviews.title: great experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013
reviews.text: - Arrival: we arrived at before check-in time so our room was not ready. We were greeted with complimentary sparkling wine and many apologies for our room not being ready. Matty (who is on staff at the hotel) pulled us aside and spent a good 15 minutes with us reviewing a map of Seattle and educating us on options to visit during our stay. We deeply appreciated the time and care that he showed us as we were sipping our wine and waiting for our room to be ready. We were able to store our bags and take a nice stroll down 1st Ave. to grab lunch and explore the area. The hotel called us an hour later to let us know that our room was ready for our arrival. Upon arrival, we were given keys to our room and found that our bags were already in the room for us. A very nice touch.
reviews.title: Everything and more!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Room: The room was really modern and very clean. As many previous reviewers outlined, the room is dark but it didn't bother us at all. The bathroom is amazing! We loved the huge bathtub with the water that filled the tub from the ceiling! The shower was modern, clean, and had an amazing shower dome. I have to say that the bathroom was my favorite spot in the room! The lounge chair and foot stool were very much appreciated and used by us during our stay. We also loved the Keurig coffee maker with enough coffee options for us to enjoy two coffees each morning during our stay (medium and bold roast). We appreciated and used the free wifi, and morning newspaper.
reviews.title: Wonderful, romantic stay, great hotel and great spa
superficially nice but fails on the basics
reviews.text: - Location: The hotel is central to everything. It was a 5 minute walk to several breakfast options (outside of the hotel), a 10 minute walk to Pike Market, a 10 - 15 minute walk to the ferry to Bainbridge Island, a 30 - 40 minute walk to Capitol Hill, and 15 minute walk to the waterfront area. Very convenient and safe location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I recently went here for 4 nights and had a blast. The rooms were great, hotel staff was awesome, service was excellent, and the Boka restaurant was really good too. Loved the location - easy to get to some of the must-see's in Seattle. Would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Great getaway hotel in an excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: From the moment you arrive at the Valet at Hotel 1000 you know you're someplace special. You immediately get a warm friendly greeting, assistance with your luggage and are whisked away into the lobby and introduced to the front desk receptionist. Before you know it, you have a glass of champagne in hand while you provide your check in credentials. You're then escorted to very well appointed accommodations hosting every amenity you can think of from computer ports to an amazing bathroom. The hotel restaurant and spa are first rate and the location can't be beat. At your departure, the valet goes so far as to supply your vehicle with bottles of complimentary bottled water and even synchs your seatbelt for you! In my years of travel, my recent stay at the Hotel 1000 was one of my best hotel stays ever.
reviews.title: Best Hotel in Seattle

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After attending a winemaker dinner at BOKA, Denny the manager of Hotel 1000 had a conversation with my wife and she arranged for a surprise stay for 2 nights at Hotel 1000. All I can say is that from arrival to departure we were treated professionally and the staff insured that all our requests were handled quickly and to our satisfaction. Our upper floor room had a great view to the west, with sweeping sunsets and views of the ferries coming and going. Perched between Pike St Market and Pioneer Square, the central location provided us ample opportunities to explore the waterfront for our morning walk and also gave us many choices for dinner, including their own restaurant, BOKA. Drinks were excellent at the bar with a great vibe. Food is terrific, with many NW favorites on the list. Our room was softly decorated with modern decor and beautiful fixtures. Elevators were readily available even during the busy mornings and around the dinner hour. Pricing for a room is actually a great value compared to many in the area. Thanks Denny for taking care of Robbi at the wine tasting and we will surely use Hotel 1000 as a weekend getaway in the future.
reviews.title: Birthday wish

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel for July 4th as we were arriving in Seattle the day before our cruise was to embark, choosing their "Snooze & Cruise" package. I'll give you some details below, but in sum: the room was beautiful, the staff had a terrific attitude and the package was not worth the price or the hassle. I would recommend staying here but carefully analyze the prices involved if you are considering this package.
reviews.title: Great room, package not worth it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is conveniently located in downtown, albeit next door to an "adult" shop (not a problem). Our room was very large and included a big soaker tub which filled from a spout in the ceiling - very cool! Like so many modern hotel rooms these days, the bathroom is separated from the bedroom by a clear glass panel, but it has the option to electronically roll down a privacy shade, which is a nice feature. All of the staff were very enthusiastic to be helpful, and although our room wasn't ready for early check-in, they made it very convenient by delivering our luggage to our room while we were out having lunch, which was much appreciated after a long flight. They had also delivered to our room a package sent by a friend as a gift, so all we had to do after lunch was pick up our keys and settle in. Another very nice feature of this place is that on each floor, in the hall right outside the elevators, is a wooden freezer chest containing individual packaged bags of ice to take back to your room. (I love that - it's always such a hassle to go hunting for ice on various floors of a hotel.)
reviews.title: Spectacular hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011
reviews.text: Great location but definitely not 5 star. Ver clean and modern and the boutique feeling. We were happy that it was close to to everything. You have to check out Brooklyn at happy hour time. Back to the hotel, the staff was very friendly and very attentive. The lounge next door is very nice and great to pop in after a long night. Overall we were happy and will return when we are in Seattle again.
reviews.title: Expensive for what it is........

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Started with friendly staff and a glass of champagne at check-in and went uphill from there. The room was immaculate and had a very cool and modern, yet comfortable feel. It may be an unnecessary effect to have one's bath water come out of the ceiling above, but it got this non-tub soaker to run a bath! Added touches such as a French press coffee maker, soft robes and even a fun little rubber ducky really made an impact. Somehow I didn't even mind that my window faced directly into the side of the next building. The bed was incredibly comfortable and I did not experience any outside noise.
reviews.title: Loved Hotel 1000

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast in the hotel's restaurant was lovely - my dish of fresh mixed berries and sliced grapes was far superior than the usual bowl of under-ripe melon and hard pineapple I'm used to at some of the chain hotels. The front desk, cleaning and restaurant staff were all very helpful and extremely courteous. Very impressed with Hotel 1000 and would recommend it to anyone.
reviews.title: THe best birthday trip ever.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I took my husband here as a surprise birthday weekend getaway. While checking in, the hotel manager asked us what brought us to the hotel. We told her it was my hubby's bday and it was a special trip for the two of us. After arriving in the room a short while later, there was a knock at the door. THe manager had sent up two cupcakes on a white plate, with "happy Birthday" spelled out in chocolate syrup on the plate. I just thought it was the sweetest thing. I can't say enough how friendly everyone one and the room was incredible. We enjoyed a dual soak in a HUGE tub that filled from the ceiling. We were able to walk to dinner at the The Met , only a block away. All in all, absolutely phenominal experience and i recommend this hotel to everyone thinking about getting away for awhile, lost in the Emerald City. THank you Hotel 1000 for an amazing trip.
reviews.title: Great Boutique Hotel in the Heart of Seattle

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: Great hotel! My girlfriend and I spent the weekend and had an outstanding time. It is convenient to all of downtown and walking distance to Pike's Place, Museums, Waterfront and many other sites. Rooms are well designed. Not overly large but we didn't feel like we were stumbling over each other either. Used the spa and had drinks in the bar...both were excellent. Next time I am in Seattle, I'll definitely stay at Hotel 1000.
reviews.title: Top Notch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Fabulous!!!!!!!!! The hotel was great - took another reviewer's advice and parked on the street for free (couldn't find a cheaper parking garage than the hotel and that was way expensive). Breakfast buffet in The Studio was incredible. Almost died at the price ($15) but then found out that it was about the same cost as the breakfast buffet at the Courtyard.... The Studio's was classier, more elegant and exotic for roughly the same amount of money. The room was heavenly. Staff were great. Enjoyed the spa. Couldn't figure out how to make the Starbucks coffee in some funky pot - did it all wrong and
reviews.title: What a Place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: then realized there were written instructions right next to the pot. Location a little strange (downtown financial district next to an erotica shop) but within walking distance to the lively Pike Place Market. Would definitely return.
reviews.title: Outstanding service, fabulous restaurant and golf!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: Although I have not stayed at Hotel 1000, I feel compel to share my experience as a local Seattleite on its restaurant Boka, the Golf Club, and the amazing service from the staff.
reviews.title: I'm not a fan

likes.liked: — Smartly appointed rooms and common areas.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: I planned a surprise evening for my husband on our wedding anniversary, beginning with a 9 hole round of "virtual golf,", then dinner at Boka in Hotel 1000. The Golf Club downstairs offers some 50 courses around the world on high tech screen, with both men and women golf clubs available for use. We arrived 20 minutes late for our tee time and had to wait another 20 minutes before the "pro" arrived. However, the staff members were very courteous and apologetic. We were given complimentary drinks while waiting . We thoroughly enjoyed playing the front 9 hole of Mauna Kea while the staff checked in on us regularly to see how we were doing. They even coordinated with Boka Restaurant to hold our reservation since we were running behind schedule. Boka is one of THE best restaurant in Seattle with FABULOUS food, served in very modern decor and chic ambiance . Every staff member along the way congratulated us on our anniversary and made the evening so incredibly memorable.
reviews.title: Outstanding

likes.disliked: — In a perfect world it would be on 4th Street not 1st Street

reviews.text: The staff members at Hotel 1000 have converted us into loyal fans, and we look forward to many more dining/golfing trips and stays there.
reviews.title: Absolutely Wonderful!

reviews.text: I'll definitely be staying at Hotel 1000 again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family

reviews.text: We ordered room service the first night as we got in at 10:30 and starving - it was quick and tasty!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: The decor is modern with an Asian twist - very nicely done and attractive.
reviews.title: Amazing Decor and Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: The location was perfect - Seattle is a very walkable city and we were able to walk to the market, pioneer square, Safeco field, resteraunts and many other places form here. Many times we would pop back into the hotel on our way to something else just to take a quick rest and set off again. Which was FAB!
reviews.title: Weak Wannabe...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I live in Portland, OR and travel to Seattle, WA quite frequently for both business and leisure trips. We've stayed at numerous boutique hotels in the downtown Seattle area, but none compare to Hotel 1000. We stayed at Hotel 1000 for two nights over the weekend and it was one of the best Seattle trips we've ever experienced. The location of the hotel is ideally situated in the downtown area, with only a short walk to Pike Market, the retail district, Pioneer Square, and the waterfront. The hotel staff are both pleasant & accommodating, and the suites all feel (and smell) very fresh and clean. The rooms on higher floors have views of Puget Sound, and, on a clear day, the mountains on the Olympic Peninsula. You can relax and watch the ferries go back and forth into the sunset. The beds were very comfortable, the linens were of high-quality, and the sound-proofing in the rooms was excellent-- we did not hear city noise or any of the other guests during our entire stay, thus ensuring for a very restful sleep. The soaking tubs are the largest & deepest I've ever encountered in any hotel, and they also fill from the ceiling, which is unique in itself. The hotel also has a boutique spa, with a very accommodating staff, and the spa treatments are simply divine. I would highly suggest pampering yourself with a few nights at Hotel 1000 if you are planning a trip to the Emerald City. You will feel completely refreshed upon your check-out.
reviews.title: Best Luxury Hotel in Seattle - great location & value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having not stayed @ the Four Seasons (yet), Hotel 1000 in Seattle is an all around perfect experience. From the modern, well appointed room to the knowledgeable staff, this hotel is top of the line. From the valet to the front desk hosts, to the bartender, everyone and everything impresses. They really make an effort to personalize your stay.
reviews.title: Might be the best Seattle has to offer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are local, so we have stayed at a variety of downtown hotels. It was our anniversary. We checked in and were offered champagne. Nice touch, though it was probably offered to everyone. Even better!!! They upgraded us to a great corner room. There was a tray of chocolates waiting with our names written on edible white chocolate. They also called up to our room to see if everything was ok. I have never had that before. Turn down service with Seattle Chocolates.... great robes and a bathtub that fills from the ceiling! They have 24 hr room service. Hard to find these days.Breakfast was fresh organic food....... I had Greek yogurt and fresh raspberries and blackberries and granola. My husband had a wonderful omelet. There are a lot of very nice hotels, but the service was far better than most. This will be my first choice next time.
reviews.title: My New Favorite Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: The room was very clean and bright. Large than expected. Great view. The staff went above and beyond in every area. Great location down town I will stay again
reviews.title: Best hotel I have stayed at in a long time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband had booked a corner waterview room, and that had the best water views in the hotel. There are too many large buildings blocking the view otherwise. The person who checked us in seemed new to the Hotel, so I didn't find our greeting particularly gracious, but the check-in was fairly quick. For instance, she knew nothing about the direction our room would face. I'd heard all about the ceiling fixture from where the water flows into the tub below, so I was prepared to be awed, but the water splashed out of the tub onto the floor tiles (making the floor slippery) and nearby window, so this isn't a feature I'd repeat in my home. The tub was long and narrow and the window looked onto an adjacent building. There was an electronically operated shade, so our privacy was preserved, but not its views. Our room's furnishings all showed wear, which surprised me given the price of our room $400+, but the high quality sheets and pillows made for a wonderful night's sleep. We were provided with french press-ground coffee, which was magnificent - a clear contrast to the bland coffees provided elsewhere. The city location afforded nice shopping opportunities, and it's only a few blocks away from Pike Place Market, a "must" for tourists. The valets were on top of our requests and very helpful. We were here for a special anniversary and the Hotel provided a white-chocolate plaque decorated in milk chocolate with our names, which accompanied six chocolate creams. We had a very good time. The downstairs restaurant seemed to be hopping, but the guest quarters upstairs were quiet. Our Internet connection kept failing, but we didn't need it much, anyway. Be prepared: it's $36.00 for overnight parking.
reviews.title: In-City Luxury - mostly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: I travel for business weekly, and travel to Seattle very frequently. I also stayed at a variety of hotels. Hotel1000 leads the pack in terms of service and quality. The rooms and beds are extremely comfortable, they have a decent gym for exercising (a few ellipticals, tread mills, weights, machines etc.), but their level of service is what always impresses me. They make me feel like I am at my home away from home, remember how I like the room (temperature, location within the hotel etc), and have always found a way to complete every request I have. A great example of their service is that when I check in, they always have a few pictures of my family in my room. Granted, I am a frequent traveler to their hotel, but I am a frequent traveler to other hotels as well, and this is the only one that has gone to this extent to make me feel comfortable. I must also say, living and traveling in the Pacific Northwest, with our inclement weather, I love the fact that they will have my shoes shined and ready for me by the next morning! Like the title of this review, if you go to Seattle, this is the hotel you should stay at. You won't be disappointed.
reviews.title: If you travel to Seattle, this is the hotel you should stay at!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I went to Seattle for a long weekend and stayed at Hotel 1000. LOVED IT!! The staff was friendly, I LOVED the glass of champagne we were given when we checked in, our room was clean and nice with a lovely view of the bay. The location is FANTASTIC, walking distance to everything (for us anyway) and next time we will try out the virtual golf! The restaurant is also a highly rated and lived up to the hype.
reviews.title: GREAT PLACE!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at Hotel 1000 for a weekend getaway (we are locals). The hotel is perfectly situated downtown, the views are stunning, service was impeccable (champagne upon arrival), accomodations were well layed out and the tub is unbeatable! I would HIGHLY recommend staying here - great value for the price!
reviews.title: Excellent Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: One of the best hotel stays ever! Clean, clean, clean! Beautifully decorated - AMAZING staff. Felt like I was on vacation in the room even though I was there for work. Everyone was personable, attentive, warm and welcoming. The room was spacious - CLEAN - and super comfortable. I slept like a baby after an incredible room service meal that came to my wacky specifications - love this place and highly recommend!
reviews.title: Warm, clean and luxurious stay - Not to be missed!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I expected it to feel pretentious and it wasn't, and it was one of the nicest hotels we've stayed in. We could tell that the staff was well trained in customer service. Our suite was large, well decorated, quiet, and very comfortable. Our only complaints were the moldy smell in the bathroom, and that they advertised "live music" in the lounge in the their information book and there wasn't any.
reviews.title: This hotel deserves its good ratings.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: Obviously a great property, as echoed by the general theme of other reviews. There were two reasons I highly rate this property:
reviews.title: Style and Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. The property and especially the rooms are very engaging. The colours, textures, and materials really invite you to enjoy the experience of being in the room, and few properties really excel in that regard. Great electronics and Molton Brown toiletries are pluses as well.
reviews.title: Anniversary bliss

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2. I also found the service to absolutely excel. I was staying on AA miles on a first visit and mentioned to reception after seeing the otherwise great room that I was an extremely light sleeper and thought street noise might be a problem. The hotel was virtually full, but the receptionist scanned a moment and came up with a suite in a very quiet location. Many properties would not have done the upgrade, which I consider a testament to their service culture.
reviews.title: Cannot wait to go back.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Used the light rail to and from the airport, as the station is just a short walk from the hotel, and they offer complimentary service in their Caddy to nearby locations in the city core.
reviews.title: Great first impression...a few dissapointments

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: We cashed in some air miles to stay here on our last night in Seattle as we couldn't get another night at our B&B. Surprisingly, it included tax so we were off to a good start. I picked this based on the TA reviews and because I wanted a great bathroom and a great tub. I got it! We were greeted with a glass of champagne on arrival in honor of our anniversary (nice) and then got an upgrade to a corner room, higher up. We paid for this and it was a great room, but as we were only there overnight - I'm not sure I'd do it again if it were not a special occasion. Totally worth it though - gorgeous, huge room. Chocolate platter delivered to our room. Amazing nights sleep - so quiet and bed was huge and comfy. And the tub! Bliss.
reviews.title: Slipped in customer service,

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoy traveling and comfort and service of 5 star hotels. After considering several Seattle hotels at which we've previously stayed, I chose Hotel 1000 because of the stellar reviews it received. We were pleased beyond expectation. We stayed 6/11 - 6/13 and 6/19 - 6/22..
reviews.title: A terrific new find for us, conveniently located with an excellent staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: The property is clean; and our room on both stays were clean, quiet, comfortable, and beautifully appointed. All staff, including the valets, were friendly, helpful, knowledgeable, and we've many stories of kindnesses they extended throughout our 2 stays including upgrading us to a higher floor on our second stay and remembering [with chocolates from Boka] that my birthday was sometime between our two stays. And they provided the extra pillows as requested. They truly make each guest feel special.
reviews.title: Very Nice Staff and Chic Accommodations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Boka is a wonderful restaurant; and we'd especially like to commend the hostess on duty the morning of 6/12. The front desk had suggested Boka for breakfast. We waited to be seated as a sign advised but no one responded. Jet-lagged; we finally left. As we were leaving a young woman [I wish I could remember her name] who had been setting up tables outside thanked us for coming to Boka. We said we'd been waiting to be seated; and no one responded. She apologized; but we left to enjoy a more welcoming place.
reviews.title: Family vacation made even better!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we returned, that young woman intercepted us as we entered the hotel lobby and made the effort to, again, apologize for not having seen us waiting. That, to us, elevated Boka's level of service. All our meals at Boka were enhanced by this young woman's sincere concern.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: We are creatures of habit; and we enjoy having a comfortable home base wherever we visit. Hotel 1000 will now be our home in Seattle.
reviews.title: Best City Hotel Ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well, everything started out perfectly at this hotel. It is very boutique chic, kind of W Hotel at half the price. We were super impressed with the room and the bathroom with the tub that fills from the ceiling. They have Molten Brown bath toiletries, and lush towels. Everything seemed top notch. We were staying there for my birthday weekend for 2 nights. When we got back to the room the first night, we tried to watch a movie, but neither the remote control nor keyboard were working for the TV, so we couldn't get internet or TV. We called the front desk and they sent someone up, but he couldn't fix it. We asked them to fix it during the day while we were out the next day. When we returned to our room at the end of the night the next night, we had a really nice tray of truffles and chocolate covered strawberries with both still and bubbly water. We aren't sure to this day if it was for the broken TV or for my birthday. They didn't say. But it was a nice touch either way. Nonetheless, the TV still wasn't working properly nor was the internet, and we couldn't watch a movie again. And the screen on the phone (which is like a mini computer screen) was supposed to automatically dim at around 9pm, but it didn't and it was so bright lighting up the whole room, we had to cover it with towels and a pillow. Also, there was a light bulb burnt out in one of the closets, and it is so dark in these rooms that we couldn't see what we had in there. They didn't replace that either and so we swapped the bulb from one closet to the other, but then the light wouldn't go out when we closed the door. That was probably why it burnt out in the first place. Also, our desk lamp was broken and just hanging off it's base...I was surprised they'd let it just hang like that and not fix it before occupying the room. The final thing was that the lounge wasn't open at all, so we couldn't sit in our hotel and have cocktails which was too bad.
reviews.title: Mixed Feelings

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: I handed a list of broken things to the front desk person when I checked out, and he just said sorry, and didn't offer up any sort of rebate or consolation for the shortcomings. I followed up when I got home with an email to the manager who'd left us the truffles, and he never replied to my email. I actually had to phone him a month later to ask him if he'd gotten my email, and he said sorry but he'd forgotten about it. He didn't offer and sort of consideration either.

description: Hotel 1000 is Seattle's premiere luxury destination. Discover the many distinctive qualities that differentiate Hotel 1000: from fully integrated, wired-to-serve technology to initiate, soothing, residential design to delightful surprises - a bathtub that fills from the ceiling and artwork that meets your personal preference.
